reviews.text: The lady who makes subs there is really nice. No tables to sit down in eat. It's in the middle of SE DC so there's tha

The customer services on a A+ ,☆ level. This lady be by herself every time I come to this restaurant.  Subway as a sandwich shop is incredible, fresh. But the owner must dont know what goes down at his store. The everything as she dont have a title ,cause she literally do it all, and I mean all. But he/she owner need to promote her to the highest level he has to offer plus a raise for every position she does.  And the sandwich be A1 on point and delicious..

I didn't even want to give it a 1 star. Its no stars for me.! This store has false advertising! They'll charge YOU A COMBO PRICE AND YOU WONT EVEN GET A CHIP AND DRINK! THE STAFF IS EXTREMELY RUDE AND TALKS OVER WOMEN! I ASKED FOR A MANAGER WHEN I CALLED ONCE AND THEY HUNG UP ON ME. THIS FOOD IS NOT TASTY NOR FRESH AND A WASTE OF MONEY!!!!

Staff is very nasty! And food is not worth the money ! I didn't even want to buy anything but i was hungry & took one bite and spit it out. Three food away and went to Jimmy John's.Where i should've went the first time!!!

You gotta be in the mood to deal with hood, disrespectful and no good employees when deciding to come get some food from here. Oh and they close whenever they feel like it, hours of operation say they close at 8pm but by 6:30-6:45pm the was closed (1/19/2021)

name: Turning Natural
vicinity: 2025 Martin Luther King Junior Avenue Southeast, Washington

reviews.text: Turning Natural is a great place to visit for Smoothies, Juices & they even carry some Dodah’s Kitchen items. The Nipsey Blue Smoothie was great & I was pleasantly surprised by the Dodah’s Kitchen Vegan Blueberry Cheesecake.

Very GREAT customer care! I stopped in here after my appointment at the chiropractor just a few doors down to see what they had available and was pleasantly surprised. I loved the colors on the wall and how everything was set up. The smoothie was very good and as I said before the CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT! Thank you again for a nice experience and I wish you much success!✨💜✨
Surprisingly really great service. Lady making the drinks and her son were really pleasant. Glad to have met them.

walked by and decided to see what this establishment was all about.  this was on saturday, an incredibly knowledgeable and friendly young lady helped me thru the menu and described some of the additives i wasnt familiar with.  she gave me her favorites and i wish i could remember, but whatever it was it was amazing.  my only issue with this place is the viscosity of the smoothies vs the paper straw ... warning you only have about 5 minutes to finish your drink before the straw becomes useless.  smoothie 5/5; straw 0/5.
Love this place I get the Spinach Patty thave tried a few different smoothies and its in Anacostia so that, a plus for ne

My wife and I finally got a babysitter to watch our son and decided to go out for a nice date night. We love Italian food and wanted to try something new. I read great reviews online about Morini and wanted to try it for ourselves. I was able to quickly make reservations from their website the same day.  The location is nice right off the water with a great view. The lighting and ambiance of the restaurant was romantic for our date night. The staff sat us at our table quickly and the waiter was very polite and knowledgeable about the menu. The food and drinks were very good and full of flavor.  I highly recommend the tagliatelle and cappelletti pastas.  My wife and I both enjoyed our meal and drinks. Highly recommend this restaurant and will return for another date night.

I delivered balloons to this beautiful location set on the walkway near the water. Parking was interesting. I am so grateful someone left while I was delivering the balloons. I did not eat there . The staff was absolutely amazing and very helpful.

This place had always come recommended. Paul is the General Manager and wears his heart on his sleeve. He is committed to giving a great service and is really responsive. Our server was Edith and she was incredible- attentive, witty and just committed to a great experience.

One of the great things about this restaurant is they don’t rush. We had appetisers and then waited a while and had drinks. It’s a proper Italian experience. Their wine list also reasonable and has great optionality.

This is a great restaurant with staff that care. Would recommend highly and a stunning water view to boot.
Food and service at this establishment was absolutely amazing. Our server Eislym was attentive, friendly and very helpful. Definitely recommend and will come back to try other things on the menu.

We’ve been here twice now and it’s very yummy. The first time was outstanding. The burger was phenomenal and the pasta was so so delicious. We tried again during restaurant week and were less impressed. The desserts were yummy as well as the appetizers but the main entree was very meh at best. Overall the atmosphere is great, service is always wonderful and the drinks are good. I’m sure we will be back!

Stopped in for happy hour for a few drinks and dinner.

It took about 15 minutes before anyone came over to serve us. Another woman near us also left during our dinner because no one came over to take her order.

Once the server came over, our food was out within 5 minutes and the waiter was very attentive. The food tasted great  Tacos were very flavorful, but I was still hungry when I left. The frozen margaritas were good, but they tasted like there was too much salt in them. I would be willing to try it again, but hopefully the service is better.

I had a great time here! The food was really good and so were the drinks 🍻. I like the atmosphere and they played good 🎶🎵 although I wish it was a little louder🔊.  The service was great and very fast. I like that they have hooks for you to hang your coat at the bar and outlets as well🔌. On the price front, they are in line with the area and I ended up spending less 💸👛 than I thought 💭

Enjoyed my huge shrimp quesadilla with lots of mildly spicy shrimp pieces. My friend's fish tacos were fine but not special. The accompanying black beans were notable. The tortilla chips were fresh and the mild salsa made it easy to wait for our meal. We sat outside and the service was timely.

I see a lot of the reviews are based off of the service there but my review is solely from take out. I live across the street and hadn't tried this place. I ordered one afternoon and it was so good I ordered the following day for dinner. Having lived in Mexico I can say this isn't "authentic" Mexican cuisine, but it's great for the Americanized version that it is lol. The crab cakes and salmon salad are a MUST! I'll be back for sure!

Went last night. Service seemed to be off. While our waiter was cool, it seemed to take a while to order for food. My frozen margarita-Lime was good, basic. My nachos were ok.

Would've been amazing with queso on them, but I think that was extra. Prime location, I'm sure it's a hot spot in the spring/summer.  I'll at least give them another try.

Great location in view of the river. I came for happy hour, enjoy two glasses of the house white wine, Chicken sliders, and the corn and crab fritters. The service was surprisingly slow, considering it was less than five people in the restaurant, but sometimes it be like that. I’d recommend coming for happy hour.

If you like biscuits, this is a great place to have them. Saturday brunch was wonderful. Not an extensive menu, but it is very filling. Our server, Dewey was the best. Great views as well. Definitely going back.

I visited this place for the first time with a group celebrating a friends birthday at Brunch.  Our server Mike was great, as was his server in training Lee (Leigh) - and though we had to wait for refills on the bottomless mimosas at time, they more than made up for it by being attentive and providing great service.

So… Lets start with the good.  The service is great, the bathroom is clean, and the mimosas are strong - sadly thats where my accolades end.

The food is ABYSMAL.  Imagine opening a can you of wet cat food, sniffing it, and then mixing it with gravy and pouring it over a biscuit.  That’s the vibe that the sausage gravy gave me, and yes it made my stomach tumble.

The chicken breasts were inconsistent across the table.  The Chicken and Waffles chickens were all salty (as hell), while the Hot Fried Chicken chickens were completely under seasoned and the “Nashville Hot Sauce” won’t hot at all.

The collards tasted like vinegar, the eggs tasted as though they came from a carton, and the waffles were tough.  ANDDDDDD I don’t know who told them that putting pickles and picked onions atop an egg was a good idea - but the madness must stop.

Overall - I’d come back here and sit at a table to have Mike bring me drinks.  I loved the diversity in the staff, and that I never felt out of place in the restaurant.

Ambiance is nice, service was good considering it was busy. Food and flavors was off/not what I expected even the drinks weren't that great. My cousins meal - the open faced chicken biscuit was hard/cooked improperly and the chef agreed to remake it but by then they'd run out of home fries. The veggie scramble I ordered lacked flavor and the side of hot sauce was more vinegar in flavor and did nothing to increase the flavor of the scramble. The home fries were good though a few of them were under cooked. My froze' tasted like pure alcohol, no sweet quotient unlike the froze' I've had other places. The crab and corn fritters were overcooked slightly and were "ok" in flavor. It's a no for me, will not revisit.

First-time trying this restaurant for brunch. We all got the Hot Fried Chicken. It was very delicious! I usually pass on bread, but those biscuits are AMAZING! My son substituted the egg with sautéed spinch. The drinks were good too! The Shoo Fly Punch is really refreshing, the Spike Peach Tea is sweet but really, really good! I will be going back to check out the dinner menu. They have outdoor patio dining and it's near the water, nice scenery and atmosphere.

My husband and I dined for an early dinner on Valentine's Day. There is construction going in the area so give yourself extra time, but there is a parking garage so you won't have to hunt when you arrive.
The host was really friendly and we were immediately taken to our table. Our waiter, Jason, was excellent. He shared recommendations, explained how to order from the raw bar, and helped me pick the perfect drink. The food was wonderful! It wasn't too loud or too crowded. Outdoor dining was available and they had heaters to keep guests warm. We went at 1715 so it wasn't very crowded in our area but before we left quite a few more tables were in use than when we arrived. If you're concerned about the crowd, an early dinner around 1700 is perfect, you'll be wrapping up as the crowd is starting to arrive. We will absolutely return to fine again!

This is one of the lesser known gems among seafood restaurants in the DC area, but we had a great meal. View cannot be beat although parking can be a bit tough given that it is right next to the baseball stadium. If you can get street parking you are very lucky. The oysters were very fresh and tasty, and the service was top-notch. Standard fare like fried seafood and hearty side dishes were all very good.

We have eaten at Salt Line regularly for years, and it is among the best approachable seafood spots in DC. Go with the raw bar or our faves: the smash burger and the lobster roll (with butter, of course). Don’t miss the baked pimento cheese app (and ask for extra chips with it). Outdoor seating on the water is available (with some of the best heaters in DC during the winter). The outdoor bar is also great and lively with good drinks and crowds during happy hour or before or after Nats games.

I finally had some Pappy van Winkle!  Outstanding location with a beautiful view outside and comfortable setting inside.  The menu items are fantastic making it hard to choose just one thing.

The clam selection is fantastic, as is the presentation.  The clam chowder is very good, but not as good as the other food items that our group purchased.

The staff is very friendly, efficient and engaging.  The food was terrific and the drinks were perfectly mixed.

Great experience and I highly recommend it.

My friend and I enjoyed a very tasty lunch here. Taking advantage of the half price special on local oysters on the Friday midsummer afternoon, I feasted on Chesapeake Bay oysters from both Maryland and Virginia. As the Virginia ones were not large as promised, the restaurant provided an extra oyster for my enjoyment.  I also liked the only salad on the menu with thin sliced veggies among the spring mix. My friend raved over the fish sandwich on its super tasty bun.

We really enjoyed this place! The drunken noodles were good (definitely a medium spicy level) & the pad thai was flavorful.
Next time we want to try the mango sticky rice and the pineapple fried rice because it comes in a pineapple— we are just too stuffed today!

Definitely the spot in navy yard to get quick and good Thai. They also serve sushi and are super quick if you dine in or take out. Also the spicy is there but they don't kill you unless you ask. I would say this is a go to lunch spot for people working at the navy yard or dinner take out for the residents of navy yard.
I've been here once before and it didn't disappoint. The authentic Thai food and ambiance is amazing. I love the pineapple rice. The cocktails were to die for!

A group of us were taking a boat ride from Navy Yard so, we wanted to have dinner first. After a quick vote we landed on Thai food. We were a group of six. We were greeted and sat immediately about 5ish on a Friday night without a reservation.

Once seated our server was NOT friendly at all. I mean short and rude. I'm unsure why she was so rude since the restaurant just opened at 4:30. The menu was reasonably priced and there is quite a variety to choose from as well as sushi. I do think that it's a little unreasonable to charge an additional $4 to add broccoli to any dish😲 broccoli is just a vegetable and pretty cheap to come by. The food overall was delicious and very flavorful and they understood spice levels well.

We didn't order any drinks so I can't give my opinion on those. Of course the gratuity was included in the check since we were a party of six, but our server definitely didn't even deserve that. Overall I might order to go because the food is good, but I definitely would not sit in. We should have went to the Mexican restaurant 🤷🏽‍♀️

I only been here for sushi. They have good beer that’s the cheapest price you’ll find in that neighborhood. They have the usual sushi items you’ll find at most places but there wasn’t enough vinegar in the sushi rice which I think is very important. I’m gonna be critically honest but I think the sushi I ordered wasn’t that fresh. Other than that, it’s also a Thai restaurant. I think it should drop the sushi items and focus on Thai and southeast Asian cuisine.

name: Mama's Pizza Kitchen
vicinity: 2028 Martin Luther King Junior Avenue Southeast, Washington

reviews.text: I saw the good reviews yet was truly disappointed by the food. Mozzarella sticks couldn’t even pretend to be crispy. Breading was very doughy, unseasoned, no browning whatsoever. Chicken wings were overbaked, dry and completely flavorless (pic is the “garlic Parmesan” I ordered) They were also the size of hummingbird wings. Pizza was better, though undercooked. Sauce was super sweet and the toppings had never seen a lick of flame. SMH. Get it together Mama because I can see Nonna rolling over in her grave.

Amazing food and excellent service UNTIL the African-American female with the big ear rings, nails, and visor came to "help" with a phone-in order. She wasn't just rude but downright nasty to my lady friend -- AND DIDN'T GIVE ME A RECEIPT! The food is so good that I can't say that I won't come again, but if she's there we may turn around.

PS - EVERYTHING is good here.

I ordered from here via the Slice app. I did not want Pizza bolis or some other subpar chain. Mama's delivered! Pizza was really good! Perfectly cooked and still piping hot when it arrived. The wings were great I got spicy buffalo. Delivery was on time! Will definitely be ordering from here again.

What happened!?!? We've been ordering from here every other week for almost 2 years. The last three months the quality has gone down to the point of inedible, the sauce has changed and not in a good way, and the delivery time has been horrendous. Last night we ordered a pizza and and bread sticks, both arrived ice cold and late. Should have saved $40 and had a frozen pizza. Drivers are always friendly and apologetic but I think I've been burnt for the last time with Mama's.
I think there’s a little grandma or Pa in the kitchen making the bread from SCRATCH. The garlic bread knots are delicious and hot. The chicken is good. This is a SE Foodie treasure!

This is not the Carryout I grew up with. These are new people and the food does not taste the same at all. Y'all they changed the Mambo sauce 😬 Don't waste your money! ANOTHER DC STAPLE GONE FOREVER 😭 Also they don't wear masks or gloves

It was delicious & my 1st time trying a chicken box from a DC carry out! Call ahead so you can just pick it up & pay & avoid all the rif raff that may be present. There’s plenty of parking & it moves quickly. 5 wings fried hard, SPKH, Mumbo sauce, fried rice & a half/half to complete it. $15 but delicious. Customer service was nice but she’s not playing with you so come correct! 5/5

Both times I visited, chaos enused. People rushed me, asking/demanding money and food. This was especially intimidating using their ATM (credit cards not accepted). Last time, a man literally stole my order from my hands and ran off. The proprieters refused to replace my meal, and others rushed me for donations while this happened. Bottom line, be cautious, bring cash (don't use their ATM), don't visit alone, especially after dark, and bring a backpack to carry your order out.

Rude. ALWAYS RUDE. The food quality has declined but is still decent.  CHECK YOUR ORDER BEFORE YOU LEAVE THE COUNTER! I've had too many mishaps here recently (last 2 months) so I will not be returning.

I called on December the 2nd and spoke with a young lady that works at the carryout she was very pleasant so I told her that I'll call back with my order. As I get my order together with my coworkers I called that and the gentleman there is so rude

name: King City Restaurant
vicinity: 2403 Martin Luther King Junior Avenue Southeast, Washington

reviews.text: The delivery man doesn’t come to your door. He just sit in the car and you have to walk up to get your food. General TSO chicken taste nasty and the “fried rice” is yellow rice…reminds me of the Goya yellow rice. Just horrible and I will never order anything from there again. And they put my can  soda in the same bag as my food making my soda hot.

I had to wait two and a half hours for cold food. Ordered hit sour soup that had chunks of broccoli in it why?. Next the spring rolls were greasy and not tasty. Tasted old. Next the large egg fu yun was okay but too much gravy. Never again. Don't do it.

I called all 5 numbers provided on their menu and no one answered the phone. Finally someone answered on my 3rd try of calling all of the numbers and I was able to place my order at 7:30pm for delivery. The food did not arrive until 9:30pm (2hours later) and the food was cold and tasteless. I would never order from or recommend King City to anyone.

They came in a good timing but the most dry combination broccoli I’ve ever had not to mention the beef was so chewy I couldn’t eat it my broccoli was suppose to be soft but it wasn’t never ordering from here again
The food is horrible they need to shut this place down the worst carry out in DC u have homeless people in there stinking the place up they don’t clean it Im telling u DONT GO There food poisoning

name: Starbucks
vicinity: 2228 Martin Luther King Junior Avenue Southeast, Washington

reviews.text: I came to the Starbucks today to chill for 2 hours I ordered trippio espresso conpana with caramel drizo and white chocolate sauce I paid and left a tip The barista made my drink but I forgot to ask for ice when I did get the drink there was missing white chocolate they probably remade my drink at the right amount of whipped cream drizzle and sauce experience went from a zero to a 10.
Don't know about the food ..looked good but only drank coffee..staff is awesome...they will start your day with a smile ☺...very personable
My first time visiting.  It had a relaxing atmosphere and the staff was super friendly. Parking is crazy which is the only issue I have.

This location is neat, clean and overall friendly. I encountered a super unprofessional cashier who greeted me with, "it took you long enough, you were standing back there forever" his manager was on the Frontline and you could tell she was tired of the immaturity of the staff member....I corrected him very quickly and got someone else to take care of me.

I come every morning I go into work and the employees always greet me with high energy to start off my morning. They work well in sync that even with many orders I never have to wait too long. They’re very friendly and out of the many Starbucks I have visited, this location is one of the best.

name: Kings Cafe
vicinity: 2100 Martin Luther King Junior Avenue Southeast #2100, Washington

reviews.text: It was ok. The food is good for a quick bite to eat and the prices are ok. It's a popular spot and sometimes very crowded, especially around lunch time. Check them out if you're in the area!
Food is so good, there's so much, and for such a low price. I had their iced coffee too which was so sugary and AMAZING. Great morning spot. Busy but quick.

Very rude, The asain woman  was very nasty. When speaking to her she barely allowed me to speak.  In the midest of me trying to convey  what I understood about what she was saying she spoke right over me and said that if I don't want the stuff I can leave!!!! I just asked her why was she trying to charge me 50cent instead of 35 cent. Maybe because we are in SE. It's also pretty nasty to attempt to service customer with food in and on your mouth is very niggerish! I also didn't see the ladies that were were co with any type of hair net!!!!
Hello health department!!
It's a place I've been visiting all my life and I'll never stop eating mom's good food. Her kindness is unmatched the whole family is beautiful good customer service
Good food I always order breakfast sandwiches and ice coffee

name: Busboys and Poets
vicinity: 2004 Martin Luther King Junior Avenue Southeast, Washington

reviews.text:
Busboys and Poets was an excellent restaurant that is full of great art, many local events, and even a book store. This location is within a Community Collaborative building and you can feel the strong community connection.

There were many different tables for big and small groups as well as bar seating. Service was quick, too. We were a group of 8 who was able to sit immediately during Saturday brunch.

The menu marks foods which are “Gluten Free Friendly” and Vegan. Plus, gluten free bread is available for sandwiches, even though it’s not on the menu. Everyone in our group was happy with our food. Definitely would recommend and we’ll be back!

I really enjoyed my experience at Busboys and Poets, the environment is very well maintained and spacious. I love how they have art posted & a book area. The staff are very attentive and helpful, not to mention the food is delicious. I like it. Definitely gonna return

This was my first time at this location. I was too hype about getting a JFK (drink). I was told I could not get one. That was disappointing since I was visiting and do not live in the area. The service was slow, we had to ask for help but overall the food was very good and the music was a vibe. The restaurant was clean and the young lady who helped us was nice. They did try to improvise after I asked for a spiked coffee, it was good. They have a very good selection of books. There is paid parking on the side of the building.

Solid breakfast! If you are okay with a long wait to get a table, you will ultimately enjoy it. It’s nice that they have a bookstore with a lot of inspiring books to look at while you wait. The vegan options are also a plus.

I'm a regular at B&P but this was my first time at this particular location. I was very disappointed. When I first entered I was unclear if I were to stand at the front and wait for someone or go to the bar. After waiting 3+ minutes I walked over to the bar. I waited there for about 3 minutes as well, only to be told to go back to the front and wait for the host. When she came she handed me my bag but there was only one order in the bag. I waited another 5 mins for my second order. I ordered the blackened salmon and the fried chicken meal. The salmon was a little overcooked, but was edible. On the other hand, the fried chicken meal was a disaster. Either the chicken was overcooked or the grease needed changing. The mashed potatoes were stiff and bland. The collards were okay compared to what I'm used to receiving. So I ate the salmon meal and used the chicken and greens to make a soup. Not okay. I spent about 60 bucks and still left a tip. Not sure if I would return to this particular location. However, I don't want to forget that when the host did arrive, she was very kind and had great customer service.

name: 6Co Eatery
vicinity: 1916 Martin Luther King Junior Avenue Southeast, Washington

reviews.text: The steak and cheese was seasoned to perfection the only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I wanted my bread toasted/grilled well done.  Love me some skinny fries! I’m going to try the ribs next!!
A nice big juicy burger and hot fries it what I needed! 6Co hit the spot! Can't wait to try the REAL Steak and Cheese Sandwich... Let's see what I've been missing!

A must stop for some really good food. It's a hole in the wall that if you blink you will miss it. It's small and very clean. I've had the real steak and cheese sandwich and the steak and bean burrito. Both are one of the best I've had. Fresh soft bun and fresh ingredients seasoned just right. Each order is prepared to order, so it takes some time, but worth the wait.

My son's loves the chicken sandwiches, but I was disappointed in the steak quesadilla. My partner said the King burger was delicious. I waited about 50 or so minutes for all four orders he was working alone this day but he was professional and kind.

Me and my friend ate from here last night,  although there is no seating, to eat in. The food was AMAZING. We had chicken and waffles. The chicken must have had Crack in it cause.... finger licking good.

I visited this location for happy hour. I was very impressed by the professionalism and service of the staff. Upon arrival, I was greeted by the host and manager Moo. The restaurant had great vibes and ambiance. The bartender Niya was very attentive and made great drinks. We ordered wings, nachos and catfish nuggets. Food was very good. Everything was 10/10 (service, food, ambiance). I will definitely patronize this business again!

I ordered these items from this place via UberEats. From the time I first smelled it to the last bite I had was a "out-of-body" experience. You can taste every fresh ingredient in every bite. I was so impressed that I called the establishment to give my compliments to the chef personally. The gentleman I found out was behind that masterpiece named Bernard. And he turned out to be very humbled and honored by the compliment I gave him. This place is truly a "diamond in the rough. I HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone who is thinking of trying this place out. Can't wait to dine in this place myself one day. Kudos to the entire staff for such an effort!!

I just tried the Hennessy bbq wings. They were cooked perfectly and saucy just the way I like them! I wasn’t even hungry i just ordered them because i walked in with my bf to pick up his food. I couldn’t stop eating them best thing is they are a block away from my house.

I love the crab egg rolls.The  chef gave each egg roll a large amount of Crab stuffing. Great customer service at the bar waitress staff and host were attentive. It was escape for my lunch break at work.

Came in on my Mom's birthday.  Romero was is awesome server. This place gave me life.  Love it!!  Lamb was great also the Salmon large portions my mom loved it.  Banana pudding and Peach Cobber Cheesecake...worth treating yourself.  Thank you

name: ELife Restaurant Anacostia (Everlasting Life Vegan Restaurant)
vicinity: Inside the Anacostia Arts Center, 1231 Good Hope Road Southeast, Washington

reviews.text:
Best vegan soul food I’ve had! The vegan jerk chicken changed my life.

Also they gave me huge portions!! 🤩

This place is awesome! Great price for the amount of food you get! I thought it was a bit pricey at first until I saw the portion size, and it lasted me 2 meals. Everything tasted amazing. And the staff was super friendly! Kenneth, the gentleman serving the food let me sample the Mac and cheese to see which one I wanted to purchase. :) He was awesome and needs a raise! :D The sorbet was sooo good, I ate it all in one sitting. 😋 Highly recommend! Definitely one of the best vegan places I've been to, and Nashville has some pretty good places, I wish you all were in Nashville, TN! ❤️

Hubby and I attended an event at Elife Restaurant on this past Saturday Dec10th and this was our first visit and we're from NC it definitely will not be our last, the food was Amazing, cooked to perfection, We had collard greens, spinach casserole, cabbages, mac n' cheese and those desserts that pumpkin spice cake slice and I purchased a bean pie to bring home and wish I would have purchased more. Very nice clean and pleasant environment, love the energy there. Can't wait to return to the new location!

Amazing food! Cant reccomend enough. Mac and cheese was a good consistance and tasted great. Kale greens were tender and flavorful. But omg these chicken wings tasted so good, so real. We couldn't eat them fast enough. The guy who helped us was super friendly.

Everlasting Life Vegan Restaurant is the healthiest veggie/vegan food restaurant in the District/Maryland/Virginia area.  All the foods you like without the meat.  Also delicious homemade desserts and smoothies. I was plesantly surprised my first time eating there, now I'm a regular!  My health and well being has greatly improved since adopting a plant based diet.  Everlasting Life host socially conscious speakers, community discussions, and related film presentations.  Anytime is the best time to eat there.  To Your Health.  Thank You Everlasting Life Restaurant!!!

The Fresh Food Factory Market is a MUCH needed addition to SE DC. It's located inside the Anacostia Arts Center so the hours are dictated by the arts center, but they still keep reasonable hours. The owner is kind and passionate about breaking through the food desert in Wards 7 and 8.

The store itself is set up like a small organic market with fresh produce, local products, and other products. You could easily get most of your groceries here and the prices are reasonable for quality goods.

They sell wine, snacks, fruit, literally almost everything!

They also teach healthy cooking classes and host other events.

What a great place to pick up everything, fresh fruits and some veggies, seasonings, organic snacks and drinks. They have cooking demos and give away free food and flowers on Tuesdays. This is a southeast gem they accept credit cards, cash and ebt cards

Amazing amazing amazing experience!!!! I was searching for Seamoss during the pandemic shutdown. And didnt want to order it online. I came across this fresh food market and notice it was close to my house. I called to see if they were open. And the owner informed me they were closed due to the shutdown. HOWEVER, THEY STILL WERE TAKING ORDERS!! COME ON GOD!!!  I placed my order for the seamoss and she had someone meet me immediately! NOW THATS WHAT YOU CALL AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!  She was super nice and the process was so easy!! Thankful!! I will definitely continue to support the business!

5 *s for the ethic and healthy food options, for the service, for the art and most of all... for meeting a major community need!

Amazing experience !!!!!
I know the owner James. You can be confident that anything you order off the menu will be the highest quality!

It is a small place, many would probably describe it as a hole in the wall, but it didn't have that feel to me. The chef, Peter, (and I am calling him a chef by the way he listened to and took care of us, plus the confidence he put in the food), was very nice and attentive. Everything was made to order. It was a combination of West African cuisine and a small sprinkle of American and soul food dishes.

I had the crab cake sandwich, which used no nasty filler material, but mostly delicious crab meat and herbs, falling apart at every bite. It was definitely worth it, and for a good price. I had mac and cheese which was good, despite not using elbow macaroni (not sure if that's how they regularly make it or not...should have asked). My son had the grilled chicken sandwich which he tore up. The collard greens were flavored heavy with vinegar, so they are an acquired taste for me, but were better when I put lemon pepper and paprika on them at home.

The blackened salmon I brought home for somebody else who told me, I should have tried their's, and that they would go back for more. So clearly that was good. It looked delicious, very soft and tender, not dry and white.

I can't wait to taste the peanut butter soup (my favorite dish since I was a kid). So please support this establishment, I know I will! Easy to get to, since it's a couple of stores up from the Anacostia Arts Center. There are a couple of small 2-chair tables, if you want to sit and eat with your partner or child too.

Pleased to meet you, Open Crumb🙂

Open Crumb is nothing to look at - it's a simple storefront with a few bare tables, and the food is packaged for takeout in any case - but the food is unique, at least on the African side of the menu. We had the peanut soup and spinach soup, the latter with a side of brussels sprouts, and they were all very good. We also got a free sample of the seafood chowder, and it was so good we bought enough to take home for dinner - a delicious broth (not heavy like New England-style) and lots of tasty morsels in it.

Came here visiting from NC and saw this place on google maps with good reviews. I got the fried chicken sandwich and I would DEFINITELY get it again!! It was so good and very reasonable priced. The burger didn’t last for a picture 😩
All the food I ordered was amazing and perfectly seasoned. I especially loved the peanut soup and goat stew with fufu. I honestly had dreams about them and finished my leftovers for breakfast.

Open Crumb is great! After reading reviews for months, we stopped by for lunch. We were so excited. The fried chicken was fried fresh, and we also picked up some hot sauce. It stayed crispy through a 20 min drive back home to NE, and everything tasted amazing. Can’t wait to come back.

I will never order from them again! I use to order from them all the time. Today I order for myself and my children but I was at work and didn’t eat my food right away. When I looked at my food finally I noticed it was burnt. I called the restaurant and asked for a replacement. The first thing they said was they would just replace the shrimp I told the young lady no I wanted the whole meal replaced and she said no because it was only the shrimp that was burnt. Then they called me back and said because two hours had went past I had to send a picture to prove it was burnt and have someone come to the restaurant and make the exchange. So I asked her what the time had to do with anything I was at work. She proceeded to go back and forth with me. So I sent the picture and told them at that time they can keep the food I didn’t want it anymore. Because that was to much for me. I spend good money with them all the time. Never give them a issue or nothing. I will never support them again.
This carryout is so clean .nd the food OS better than ever.kerp up the good work..u will have my business.
Food was soggy and oily .shrimp egg roll was mold inside and the shrimp in the shrimp basket was nasty and idk what is in the inside of the shrimp

I totally recommend the steak and cheese from them, the steak and cheese is BOMB! The steak is not too dry and the cheese is enough and melted good. Also their mumbo sauce too! I will never complain about this place because I always get good service and they always make the food how I wanted to be. I totally recommend this to anyone, you should TOTALLY try it especially if you like steak and cheese! 👍🏻👍🏻

yuck! stay away! went in and there was police tape INSIDE! cthu! I was told to get the fish with yellow rice. big serving, but you could smell the fish.. And I suspect they caught him in the Anacostia....
The lunch specials were on point. Great value and food was delicious. Generous portions. Will always visit this spot when working on that side of town.
Never again!!! Charging for Mambo sauce.  Lost a customer over a condiment.  One and done

I ordered 2 steak & cheese and one chicken tender. After walking home in the freezing cold I called to tell them the condition of the food. By mistake the cashier (no management to talk with) confessed that their foods was pre-cooked then quickly corrected not all of it. I was told to bring the tenders back. I declined. The honey mustard for the tenders must have been a teaspoon full. The steak was not fully cooked and my daughter was sick for two days. Cashiers are always pleasant. I question the other workers that work there now. They come from the back like they are mad to be there. I guess that is why I was served food like this.
